summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys at Cohen & Gresser LLP to the U.S. Department of Justice, requesting the testimony of four law enforcement agents at her trial. The letter outlines the relevance of testimony from agents involved in both the 2006-2008 Florida investigation and the 2019-2020 New York investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)), represented by the law firm sending the letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigations referenced; his alleged sexual abuse was investigated in Florida (2006-2008) and he was indicted in New York in July 2019.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the trial where the defense seeks to call the agents to testify.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the letter representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell is indicted in connection with the investigation into Epstein's alleged crimes, as referenced in the superseding indictment.
Christian R. Everdell, on behalf of Cohen & Gresser LLP, states they represent the defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Florida FBI Investigation into Epstein
events.description: An investigation into allegations of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein conducted by the Palm Beach FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Epstein Indictment in New York
events.description: An indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was returned in the Southern District of New York (19 Cr. 490 (RB)).

events.title: Initial Maxwell Indictment
events.description: The initial indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was returned (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

events.title: Defense Request for Agent Testimony
events.description: Maxwell's defense attorneys formally request the testimony of four law enforcement agents at her upcoming trial.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor, New York, New York 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team is seeking to compel testimony from four specific law enforcement agents involved in investigations of Jeffrey Epstein.
The requested agents include those from the 2006-2008 Palm Beach FBI investigation and the 2019-2020 New York FBI investigation.
The defense argues the agents' testimony about the scope, timeline, and investigative steps is relevant and material to Maxwell's case.
The letter references a superseding indictment against Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) following the initial indictment on June 29, 2020.
The names of all four requested law enforcement agents (three FBI Special Agents and one Task Force Officer/Detective) are fully redacted in the document.
